page.title: 08THE RIVER EXE FLOODS
page.content: Sometimes when the tide is very high and the weather is very wet the River Exe bursts its banks and floods some of the streets in Topsham. This happened early in 1985 and I remember it clearly. I was staying in the house of my friend who lives by the recreation ground. We took the dogs outside for a walk and found that the water had come right up to the gate. It was about 12 cm deep. The dogs were afraid of the water but we went along as far as we could and saw other people paddling through the water. In Ferry Road some people even had a small rowing boat to get about in. The people had put sandbags against the doors of their houses to stop the water coming in.
